raw_comment:
1. A higher amount of young women than men contact their parents on a weekly basis for all kinds of contacts. In this difference is greater when texting and making phone calls. The difference is substantially smaller by 5% points for in-person visits. Texting is the most common way for people of both genders to communicate.

2. I wonder why women contact their parents much more than men, as well as why for the visit in person the difference is not as big as the other categories.

3. Many college students, which forms a big part of my friends and also where I aim to be next year to live apart from their parents, so texting and calling are our primary means of communication. It’s complicated to have time to go back home, if it’s in a different state.

4. Did Technology Change Our Relationships?
ace_sentences: More young women than young men contact their parents weekly.
This is true for all kinds of contact.
The difference is greater for texting.
The difference is greater for phone calls.
The difference is smaller for in-person visits.
The difference for in-person visits is smaller by 5 percentage points.
Texting is the most common way of communication for young women.
Texting is the most common way of communication for young men.
I wonder why women contact their parents more than men.
I wonder why the difference for in-person visits is not as big as the difference for other kinds of contact.
Many college students are my friends.
I aim to be a college student next year.
Many college students live apart from their parents.
Many college students contact their parents mainly by texting.
Many college students contact their parents mainly by calling.
It is complicated to find time to go back home.
If home is in a different state, then it is complicated to go back home.
The headline is: Did technology change our relationships?
